data.title: The Epidemiology of Urinary Incontinence, other Lower Urinary Tract Symptoms, and Pelvic Organ Prolapse
data.sourcetitle: Textbook of Female Urology and Urogynecology: Clinical Perspectives
data.abstract: Urinary incontinence (UI) and other lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS) as well as other forms of pelvic floor dysfunction such as pelvic organ prolapse are highly prevalent conditions with a profound influence on well-being and quality of life. The first delivery is considered to increase the prevalence of UI the most, and recent studies have demonstrated a further increase for each delivery. In recent years, several epidemiological studies have also been conducted in order to better understand the prevalence and the impact of overactive bladder and other LUTS. The main outcome measures were: prevalence of urinary frequency, urgency, and urge incontinence; proportion of participants who had sought medical advice for overactive bladder symptoms; and current or previous therapy received for these symptoms.
